headlines: Raveena criticises person who called her 'MILF', Twitter user says she criticised Aditi
text: Criticising an unnamed person, Raveena Tandon tweeted, "Even though you don't follow, you sure are interested. I remember you'd called me 'milf'." A Twitter user speculated it is directed at comedian Aditi Mittal, who called Raveena a 'MILF' in 2011. On Wednesday, Aditi tweeted that one of Raveena's posts appeared on her timeline even though she doesn't follow her.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: You married outside your religion, no one said a word: Swaraj's husband to Shah
text: Late External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj's husband Swaraj Kaushal defended Anupam Kher after Naseeruddin Shah called him a "clown". He wrote that as Kher's contemporary, he could confirm Kher "is an honest" man. Swaraj further questioned, "You married outside your religion. No one ever said a word...Have you not been given more than an equal opportunity?" and called Shah "ungrateful".
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Mob snatched my phone, deleted apps: Woman mistaken of conducting CAA survey
text: A mob allegedly stopped a woman, Nazeeran Bano, from collecting data for the Economic Census and manhandled her in Rajasthan's Kota on Wednesday, police said. Bano was manhandled by people who alleged that the survey was for CAA. "They snatched my phone and deleted mobile application containing data entry of about 1,000 households," Bano said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Will drag MP CM by collar if he addresses Cong rally in Delhi: SAD leader
text: Shiromani Akali Dal leader Manjinder Singh Sirsa on Wednesday said, "We challenge Congress party that...(Madhya Pradesh) CM Kamal Nath will not be allowed to address any public rally in any corner of Delhi." "We will drag him by his collar and bring him down," he added. This comes ahead of Assembly elections in the National Capital on February 8.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Give Western UP quota in Jamia, JNU to stop anti-India slogans: Union Min
text: Union Minister Sanjeev Balyan on Wednesday said if people from Western UP are given 10% reservation in Delhi's JNU and Jamia Millia Islamia, then nobody will be able to make anti-national slogans. "We'll fix them all alone, no one will be needed," Balyan added. Compared to JNU and Jamia, there're more students in Meerut College who support CAA, he said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: They are so nice, you can't even think of revenge: Kohli on New Zealand
text: On being asked if he was thinking about avenging the World Cup semi-final defeat against New Zealand, Virat Kohli said, "Honestly...even if you want to think of revenge, these guys are so nice, you can't get into that zone." "We get along really well with all these guys and it's all about just being competitive on the field," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Tragedy that players who can be better than Kohli are neglected in Pak: Razzaq
text: Former Pakistan all-rounder Abdul Razzaq has said that Team India captain Virat Kohli is lucky as the BCCI supports him well and instils the confidence in him that any player needs to succeed. He added, "I do believe that even in Pakistan we've players who could become better than Kohli, but they're neglected by our system which is a tragedy."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I created 'sexual game' WhatsApp group, it was a terrible idea: England Lions' Tom
text: England Lions batsman Tom Kohler-Cadmore has revealed he was the one who created the 'sexual conquest game' WhatsApp group, which led to his teammate Alex Hepburn getting jailed for five years for raping a woman. "I know it was a terrible idea but...it was just messages between me and some friends. Obviously it was in really bad taste," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Arguing with woman like reading License Agreement: Saudi prince told Bezos
text: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed Bin Salman sent an image on WhatsApp to Jeff Bezos before his divorce, according to an investigation. It showed a woman's picture and read, "Arguing with a woman is like reading Software License Agreement. In the end you have to ignore everything and click I agree." Bezos was in a secret relationship with Lauren Sanchez then.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: No role for any third party: India after Trump offers help on Kashmir
text: Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Raveesh Kumar said "there's no role for any third party" over the issue of Kashmir. "If there are any bilateral issues between India and Pakistan, it should be discussed between the two under provisions of Simla Agreement and Lahore Declaration," he added. His statement comes after US President Donald Trump offered help on Kashmir issue.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: 644 militants surrender in Assam along with 177 arms: Police
text: A total of 644 militants of eight banned insurgent outfits surrendered in Assam on Thursday along with 177 arms, police said. The members of the insurgent groups ULFA (Independent), NDFB, RNLF, KLO, CPI (Maoist), NSLA, ADF and NLFB surrendered in presence of Assam CM Sarbananda Sonowal. We hope all of them create an atmosphere of peace in Assam, Sonowal said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: India can grow at 7-8% for a long time, China cannot: Harvard's Kenneth Rogoff
text: Kenneth Rogoff, professor of economics at Harvard University, said India has the potential to grow at 7-8% for a long time but China does not. "India has a young population, it has a lot of potential in its infrastructure, to catch up. China is at the other end of the curve. It's reaching the end of the line," he added.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: There are a lot of difficulties to enter any market in India: Emirates
text: Emirates COO Adel Ahmad Al Redha has said there are a lot of trade rules and difficulties to enter any market in India. "As far as investment (in Air India) is concerned, there's nothing yet on the table," he added. Meanwhile, Chief Commercial Officer Adnan Kazim said "restricted" bilateral air services agreement between India and UAE is affecting both nations.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Have reserved it for the best films of my life: SRK on this decade's plans
text: During a question-answer session on Twitter, a fan asked Shah Rukh Khan about his plans for this decade. "I've reserved it for the best movies of my life," SRK replied. Another fan wrote to him, "Sir, lots of rumors about your next project...you please announce yourself." To this, Shah Rukh replied, "Main hi announce karunga aur kaun karega mere bhai."
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Pak govt suspends release of 'Zindagi Tamasha' fearing religious unrest
text: Pakistan government has suspended the release of the film 'Zindagi Tamasha' after Islamist political party Tehreek-e-Labbaik Pakistan (TLP) objected to the portrayal of a man who is "shunned after a video of him at a wedding goes viral". TLP claimed that the film "might lead (people) to deviate from Islam", with officials warning that it could lead to religious unrest.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: States' resolutions against CAA a political gesture: Shashi Tharoor
text: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor said states' resolutions against the CAA were more of a "political gesture" as citizenship is granted by the Centre and states hardly have any role in it. However, he added that "states can say they won't implement NPR-NRC" because they have a vital part in it as their officials will be conducting the exercise.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Instagram testing payment options for its 'shop' tab in India: Report
text: Instagram is planning to test payment options for its 'shop' tab in India so that users can complete transactions on the app itself unlike, being directed to the brand's website, Entrackr reported. Instagram has been testing the tab with brands for six months. Users can go to the 'shop' tab and tap on the post to see the product price.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: NDA govt eroded democracy: Chidambaram on India's democracy index rank
text: Former Home Minister P Chidambaram accused the ruling NDA government of eroding democracy and weakening democratic institutions after India dropped 10 places in the latest Democracy Index released by Economist Intelligence Unit. "Those who are in power are the real tukde tukde gang," Chidambaram added. India ranked 51 out of 167 and was listed among countries where there were "regressions".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Netaji Bose opposed Hindu Mahasabha's divisive politics: Mamata
text: Paying tributes to Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose on his 123rd birth anniversary, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that Netaji Bose had opposed the Hindu Mahasabha's "divisive politics". She described Hindu Mahasabha as one of BJP's organisation. "Netaji Bose had fought for a secular India. Now efforts are on to oust those who follow secularism," Mamata further said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Raj Thackeray unveils new saffron MNS flag, son Amit joins party
text: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray unveiled the party's new saffron-coloured flag and his son Amit was formally inducted into the party however his exact role wasn't announced. The new MNS flag features the seal of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj with the party's name displayed below it. Reportedly, this has been perceived as MNS' drift towards Hindutva ideology.
author: Shailesh

headlines: He never compromised with ideals: Shah in tribute to Bal Thackeray
text: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday paid tribute to Shiv Sena founder Bal Thackeray on his birth anniversary. Shah took to Twitter and wrote, "Balasaheb Ji was a brilliant intellect of his time, always mesmerised the masses with his oratory skills." "He always stood firm and never compromised with his ideals," he added.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Maha govt holds review meeting with police on Bhima-Koregaon case
text: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar and state Home Minister Anil Deshmukh on Thursday met Maharashtra Police to review the case of violence at Koregaon Bhima in Pune on January 1, 2018. Last month, NCP chief Sharad Pawar demanded that a Special Investigation Team be set up to probe the action taken by Pune Police in the case.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Training aircraft makes emergency landing on expressway near Delhi
text: A National Cadet Corps (NCC) training aircraft on Thursday made an emergency landing on the Eastern Peripheral Expressway near Ghaziabad's Sadarpur village. The aircraft, enroute to Hindon airbase from Bareilly, made the landing after it faced a technical problem. The 135-km-long Eastern Peripheral Expressway connects Haryana and western Uttar Pradesh.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Air tanker crashes in Australia while fighting bushfires, 3 dead
text: A Canadian-owned C-130 Hercules aerial water tanker crashed while fighting bushfires in Australia, leaving its three American crew members dead. "There's no indication at this stage of what caused the accident," a fire services official said. "Initial reports are that there was a large fireball associated with the impact of the plane as it hit the ground," the official added.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Yes Bank won't be allowed to fail, solution will emerge: SBI Chairman at WEF
text: State Bank of India Chairman Rajnish Kumar said that he has a "feeling" that Yes Bank "will not be allowed to fail" and was certain that "some solutions will emerge". "Yes Bank is a significant player in the market with an almost $40 billion balance sheet," Kumar said at the WEF. Yes Bank has been unable to raise fresh capital.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: He used injection for erection before assault, says lawyer during Harvey's rape trial
text: During rape-accused producer Harvey Weinstein's trial which began on Wednesday, prosecutor Meghan Hast told jury that he screamed at one victim that she "owed" him sex and used injections to induce an erection before an assault. "He ripped [a woman's] jeans off so forcefully that it left scratch marks," the lawyer added. "He must be held accountable," Hast further said.nn
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: It's only buzz: Shraddha on reports of marriage with rumoured boyfriend Rohan
text: Actress Shraddha Kapoor, on being asked about reports of marriage with rumoured boyfriend Rohan Shrestha during an interview with Times of India, said, "Like you said, it's only 'buzz'". "Right now, I don't have the time to think about anything apart from...movies," she added. Rohan is a celebrity photographer and son of Rakesh Shrestha, who's also a Bollywood photographer.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: US Senator Elizabeth describes favourite Indian dish; journalist asks people to guess
text: US Senator Elizabeth Warren, who's campaigning for the upcoming Presidential elections, described her favourite Indian dish during an interaction with a news website. Tweeting the description, campaign reporter Zohreen Shah wrote, "If you know what she's referring to, feel free to chime in." While a user wrote she meant 'kheer', others commented that it could be 'malai kofta' or 'paneer'.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: He did not have to do that: Steve Smith on Virat Kohli's World Cup gesture
text: Talking about Team India captain Virat Kohli's gesture during 2019 World Cup that won him the 'ICC Spirit of Cricket Award', Australia batsman Steve Smith said, "It was really nice of him." He added, "He didn't have to do that and yeah it was lovely gesture and I really appreciated that." Kohli had asked the crowd to not boo Smith.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: FIR against Azharuddin for allegedly cheating travel agent of ₹21 lakh
text: An FIR has been registered against ex-India captain Mohammed Azharuddin and two others for allegedly cheating a Maharashtra travel agent of nearly ₹21 lakh. The agency owner alleged that he booked various international flight tickets for Azharuddin and others but he wasn't paid. Azharuddin dismissed the allegation and said he'll file a defamation case worth ₹100 crore against the complainant.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: He is free to go: Nitish to JD(U) leader who questioned alliance with BJP
text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Thursday criticised party leader Pavan Varma for questioning JD(U)'s tie-up with BJP for Delhi elections, saying he's "free to go" wherever he likes. Varma on Tuesday shared a letter wherein he mentioned that Kumar has expressed apprehensions "in private" about BJP's "divisive" agenda. "If anyone has issues they should discuss within the party," Kumar added.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Bike rental startup Bounce raises $105 mn from FB Co-founder's VC firm, others
text: Bengaluru-based bike rental startup Bounce has raised $105 million at a valuation of $520 million in Series D funding round led by Accel Partners and Facebook Co-founder Eduardo Saverin's B Capital Group. Other existing investors including Falcon Edge and Chiratae Ventures also participated in the round. Notably, Asia Co-head at B Capital Group, Kabir Narang, will be joining Bounce's board.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Was told 'throwbacks' occur on Thursdays: Tata shares pic of himself from 1962
text: Tata Trusts Chairman Ratan Tata on Thursday shared a picture of himself from his days in Los Angeles. "I was going to post this yesterday, but I was told about 'throwbacks' and how they occur on Thursdays," Tata wrote. After completing B.Arch in 1962, Tata worked with an architecture firm in Los Angeles before returning to India in late 1962.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Who was 16-yr-old Muhsin, honoured with bravery award posthumously?
text: President Ram Nath Kovind honoured 16-year-old Muhammed Muhsin from Kerala's Kozhikode with ICCW National Bravery Award (Abhimanyu Award) posthumously on Wednesday. Muhsin had saved three of his friends from drowning in a sea but lost his life in the process. "I'm proud of Muhsin. I'm not sad at all. He gave his life for a good cause," his father said.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Delhi court acquits man accused of rape, says 'woman was his wife on that day'
text: A man accused of rape by his estranged wife has been acquitted by a Delhi court, observing that "the complainant was married to the man on that day". The woman had left the accused after he was convicted and jailed for theft. She complained about him after he allegedly visited and made physical contact with her repeatedly after his release.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: 8-yr-old hospitalised with swollen legs after teacher makes her do 450 sit-ups
text: A tuition teacher in Maharashtra's Thane has been booked for allegedly making an eight-year-old student do 450 sit-ups for not completing her homework, police said. The girl had swelling in her legs and was admitted to a hospital. The teacher, identified as Lata, has allegedly stripped the girl last month as well and beat her for not completing her homework.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Tihar asks Nirbhaya convicts their last wish, says 'they haven't responded yet'
text: Tihar Jail authorities in Delhi have asked the four Nirbhaya gangrape and murder convicts to list their last wish before they are hanged to death on February 1. "We're awaiting a reply from them. None of them have responded so far," an officer said. The convicts have also been asked to name anyone they wish to meet one last time.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Pak spews venom, takes to hate speech like fish takes to water: India at UN
text: India criticised Pakistan at the United Nations for raking up the Kashmir issue at the international forum. India's Deputy Permanent Representative to the UN K Nagaraj Naidu said Pakistan spews venom and takes to hate speech like fish takes to water. "Pakistan needs to reflect that there are no takers for its false rhetoric," Naidu added.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: White House confuses Iraq with Iran, says Trump met Iranian President
text: The White House confused Iraq with Iran and mistakenly captioned its video on YouTube writing that US President Donald Trump met with Iranian President instead of Iraqi President. Trump met Iraqi President Barham Salih in Davos on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum. "We've been friends and the relationship is very good," Trump said about Salih at the meeting.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: US mother kills her 3 kids, puts bodies on sofa to make it look like they're asleep
text: A 22-year-old woman has been arrested in US' Arizona for allegedly killing her three children and then propping their bodies on a sofa to make it look like they were sleeping, authorities said. Police said the woman confessed to the crime and sang to two of the kids while smothering them. She had a drug addiction.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Through my production house, I want to make landmark films: Kangana
text: Kangana Ranaut who recently inaugurated the studio of her production house Manikarnika Films said that she "wants to make landmark films". "The idea is...not to get carried away by the pressure of making film after film or remakes," she added. Kangana further said that she is getting into production because by being "only a director, [there is no] creative liberty".
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: I find the question insulting: Shakti on being asked if she wants to act
text: Dancer Shakti Mohan, on being asked if she wants to act in Bollywood films, said that she finds this question "offensive and insulting for a dancer". "Do we ask an actress...if she will...debut as...choreographer? So, why ask such a question to us?" she added. "Am I not good enough as a dancer to prove my creativity?" Shakti further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: I agree with Kangana: Nirbhaya's mother on actress' comment on Jaising
text: Nirbhaya's mother Asha Devi has said that she "fully agrees" with actress Kangana Ranaut's remark against advocate Indira Jaising who had said that Nirbhaya's mother should forgive her daughter's rapists. Kangana had said that Jaising should be jailed with the rapists for four days. "I'm glad...someone has spoken against [Jaising] and has stood with me," Asha Devi further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Jackie, Tiger Shroff to play father-son for 1st time in 'Baaghi 3'
text: The father-son duo Jackie Shroff and Tiger Shroff will be seen together on-screen in 'Baaghi 3'. "Everyone has been waiting to see Tiger team up with his 'Hero' father Jackie since we launched him," said co-producer of the film Sajid Nadiadwala. The third instalment in 'Baaghi' franchise, directed by Ahmed Khan, will also star actresses Shraddha Kapoor and Ankita Lokhande.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Deepika 1st Indian actress to star in Louis Vuitton Pre-Fall 2020 campaign
text: Deepika Padukone has become the first Indian actress to star in Louis Vuitton's Pre-Fall 2020 campaign. Deepika took to Instagram to share the look which features her with Stranger Things-inspired cover titled 'Don't Turn Around'. "I'm...thrilled to [join] the Louis Vuitton family...[being] a part of Nicolas Ghesquière's vision...is not only exciting but also very humbling," Deepika wrote.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: CAA can be described as world's most important human rights law: BJP MP
text: BJP MP Roopa Ganguly on Wednesday said Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) should be regarded as the world's most important human rights law. "CAA will not have any adverse impact on Indian citizens. Opposition parties are spreading lies and misleading people," she added. "Despite all hue and cry over the issue, the fact remains that CAA symbolises humanism," Ganguly further said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Don't have to show documents: Andhra on conducting NPR
text: Andhra Pradesh government issued an order stating that the state will carry out an exercise to update the National Population Register (NPR) for a period of 45 days. During this exercise, people will not be required to submit any document. "Enumerators are...not to press for any further answers to any query if they (people) don't intend to give," it said.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Find out who ordered demolition of Bellandur houses: K'taka HC to police
text: Karnataka High Court on Wednesday directed Bengaluru City Police Commissioner to conduct an inquiry into which authority ordered the demolition of makeshift houses in Bellandur. The court has also restrained authorities from evicting the residents of makeshift homes in Bellandur ward. This comes days after over 100 houses were demolished allegedly by Bengaluru municipal corporation and police.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: India to get 1st war memorial for animals in Meerut: Report
text: India's first war memorial for service animals including dogs, horses and mules is being planned at Meerut's Remount and Veterinary Corps Centre and College, according to a report. The memorial will recognise their outstanding contribution to military service alongside soldiers, officers said. "Land has already been identified...and the preliminary design has been frozen," an officer said.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: K'taka boy who guided ambulance on flooded bridge wins Bravery Award
text: A 12-year-old boy named Venkatesh from Karnataka's Raichur will be awarded the Indian Council for Child Welfare National Bravery Awards 2019 on Republic Day. During the floods in Karnataka last year, when an ambulance driver couldn't find the road due to floodwater, Venkatesh had jumped into the water to guide the ambulance by wading through the flooded bridge.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: MHA to take charge of J&K police transfers, postings: Report
text: Ministry of Home Affairs will take charge of all transfers and postings of J&K police personnel, including junior postings such as that of Station House Officers, a report said. The MHA order reportedly states that RR Bhatnagar, advisor to the Lieutenant Governor, "will suggest appropriate measures for effective policing and intelligence gathering for effective policing at police station level".
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: US drone strike killed 10 civilians in Herat: Afghan officials
text: At least 10 civilians, including three women and three children, were killed in a drone attack carried out by the US forces earlier this month in Afghanistan targetting Taliban group, Afghan officials said on Wednesday. The strike which took place in Shindand's Herat on January 8 also killed Taliban commander Mullah Nangyalay, along with 15 other militants.
author: Kirti Joshi
